metadata.inclusion: To add the device to a Z-Wave network, the Z-Wave Controller must first be set into Add (Learn) mode. Then use a paperclip or a small pointy tool to push and hold the button in the button hole for approximately a second. The device LED will blink twice to indicate that it sends information to the Controller
metadata.exclusion: To remove the device from a Z-Wave network, the Z-Wave Controller must first be set into Remove mode. Then use a paperclip or a small pointy tool to push and hold the button in the button hole for approximately a second. The device LED will blink twice to indicate that it sends information to the Controller
metadata.reset:
WARNING! Executing a Factory Reset on a device may make it stop working as wanted, and will disable remote control of the device. The device will have to be re-added to the Z-Wave network and reconfigured afterwards, to regain the previous operation of the device. Please DO NOT execute this procedure unless it is absolutely necessary.

Push and Hold the Add/Remove button for about 15 seconds â€“ until the LED indicator turns OFF. Then release the button. The device is now Factory Reset, and removed from the Z-Wave network.

The button is located about 10 mm down in the middle of the three holes on the front. A thin tool (a very small screwdriver, a toothpick, a paper clip or similar) is needed to access the button
